title: Drawdown-Based Risk Scaling
prompt: Create an infographic showing drawdown-based position scaling strategy. Left side: Stepped diagram showing risk reduction tiers - 'Normal' (0-5% DD, 100% risk, green), 'Caution' (5-10% DD, 75% risk, yellow), 'Defensive' (10-15% DD, 50% risk, orange), 'Recovery' (15%+ DD, 25% risk, red). Each tier is a descending step with risk percentage and position size indicator. Right side: Recovery curve showing how to scale back up after drawdown recovery. Include example: 'If normal risk = 1%, at 10% DD, risk = 0.5%'. Add warning icon for max drawdown threshold. Bottom: Scale slider showing current position on the risk curve. Dark background (#0F172A). Clear educational infographic style.
negative_prompt: confusing tiers, inconsistent step sizes, hard to follow logic, too many numbers
